result.execSummary:
The defendant Yvette A Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and fees.   
Defendant is to make regular payments.
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.  
Make regular payments on Supervision fees.
Obtain/ maintain employment according to doctor's recommendation, unless a doctor states defendant cannot work and it is verified.

NO CONTACT with co-defendants; may have professional contact with Jermaine C.   
NO CONTACT OR ASSOCIATION with drug dealers.
NO prescribed prescriptions to be distributed to anyone.
NO use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Perform 50 hours of Community Service at a non-profit organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yvette A Wright

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court orders defendant to Serve 1 year in the House of Correction with Huber for medical with ZERO days credit. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:

- Seek/maintain employment according to doctor's recommendation, unless a doctor states she cannot work and it's verfied.
- Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Perform 50 hours of Community Service at a non-profit organization.
-  No contact with co-defendants.  May have professional contact with Jermaine C.
-  No contact or association with drug dealers
-  No prescribed presriptions to be distributed to anyone
-  Defendant to provide DNA Sample.  Pay all costs, surcharges, and fees.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept. Defendant to make regular payments.  
Defendant to make regular payments on supervison fees.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed, and read in for sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/12/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case remains set for trial, and final pretrial.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing, and defendant does not wish to enter a plea.  Case set for trial.   Case adjourned for status on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am, for final pretrial on 9/29/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 11/12/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Case will be removed from calendar, and no one will have to appear, IF defense FILES a letter stating he will not be filing any motions.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
Court reminds defendant to have no contact with the VA medical center.  aw

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/6/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State has turned over all discovery to defense counsel.  Defendant to have a TAD assessment.  State will provide a offer before the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.A. Medical Center; except to contest job status with attorney or union rep.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Yvette A Wright in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-27-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
